author: Heston Blumenthal
method: Place the sugar in a pan over a medium heat. Brush the sides of the pan with a pastry brush dipped in a mug of cold water. Continue this process until the sugar caramelises. (You will probably end up using a third of the water).  Add the rest of the water, coffee beans, cocoa powder, salt and chocolate.  Bring to the boil.  Pass through a very fine sieve and allow to cool. Serve cold.
ingredients: 340g/12oz unrefined sugar,  570ml/1 pint water,  40 coffee beans ,  180g/6oz cocoa powder,  pinch of salt,  60g/2oz of the best quality bitter chocolate you can find
